hints.label: def-su2-link-variables
hints.title: SU(2) Link Variables on Fractal Set
hints.content:
811: :label: def-su2-link-variables
812: 
813: For each edge $e = (n_j, n_i)$ in the Fractal Set (CST or IG edge), define the **SU(2) link variable**:
814: 
815: $$
816: U_{ij}(e) = \exp\left(i\tau \sum_{a=1}^3 A_e^{(a)} T^a\right) \in \text{SU}(2)
817: $$
818: 
819: where:
820: - $A_e^{(a)}$: Gauge field components along edge $e$ (three real numbers)
821: - $T^a = \sigma^a/2$: Pauli matrices (SU(2) generators)
822: - $\tau$: Lattice coupling parameter
823: 
824: **Physical interpretation**: $U_{ij}$ is the parallel transport operator from node $j$ to node $i$.
825: 
826: **Gauge transformation:**
827: 
828: $$
829: U_{ij} \to U_i U_{ij} U_j^\dagger
830: $$
831: 
832: **Connection to cloning amplitude:**
833: 
834: From {doc}`13_fractal_set/00_full_set.md` §7.10, the cloning amplitude factorizes as:
835: 
836: $$
837: \Psi(i \to j) = A_{ij}^{\text{SU}(2)} \cdot K_{\text{eff}}(i,j)
838: $$
839: 
840: where $A_{ij}^{\text{SU}(2)}$ contains the SU(2) structure. We relate:
841: 
842: $$
843: A_{ij}^{\text{SU}(2)} = \langle ↓ | \otimes \langle \psi_j | U_{ij} | ↑ \rangle \otimes | \psi_i \rangle
844: $$
hints.raw_directive:

hints.label: def-discrete-field-strength
hints.title: Discrete Field Strength (Plaquette Curvature)
hints.content:
852: :label: def-discrete-field-strength
853: 
854: For each **plaquette** $\square$ (elementary closed loop with 4 edges) in the Fractal Set, define the **plaquette variable**:
855: 
856: $$
857: U_{\square} = U_{12} U_{23} U_{34} U_{41}
858: $$
859: 
860: where $1,2,3,4$ are the four nodes in cyclic order and $U_{ij}$ are the link variables.
861: 
862: The **field strength** is:
863: 
864: $$
865: F_{\square} = \frac{1}{i\tau^2} \log U_{\square} \in \mathfrak{su}(2)
866: $$
867: 
868: **Expansion in generators:**
869: 
870: $$
871: F_{\square} = \sum_{a=1}^3 F_{\square}^{(a)} T^a
872: $$
873: 
874: where:
875: 
876: $$
877: F_{\square}^{(a)} = 2 \text{Tr}(T^a F_{\square}) = \text{Tr}(\sigma^a F_{\square})
878: $$
879: 
880: **Continuum limit**: As $\tau \to 0$:
881: 
882: $$
883: F_{\square}^{(a)} \to F_{\mu\nu}^{(a)} = \partial_\mu A_\nu^{(a)} - \partial_\nu A_\mu^{(a)} + g \epsilon^{abc} A_\mu^{(b)} A_\nu^{(c)}
884: $$
885: 
886: (Yang-Mills field strength).
887: 
888: **Gauge invariance:**
889: 
890: $$
891: U_{\square} \to V_1 U_{\square} V_1^\dagger \quad \Rightarrow \quad \text{Tr}(U_{\square}) = \text{Tr}(V_1 U_{\square} V_1^\dagger) = \text{Tr}(U_{\square})
892: $$
hints.raw_directive:

hints.label: def-fractal-set-plaquettes
hints.title: Fractal Set Plaquette Types
hints.content:
898: :label: def-fractal-set-plaquettes
899: 
900: The Fractal Set has three types of plaquettes:
901: 
902: **1. Temporal plaquettes** (CST × CST):
903: 
904: $$
905: \square_{\text{temp}}(i,j,t) = (n_{i,t}, n_{i,t+1}, n_{j,t+1}, n_{j,t})
906: $$
907: 
908: - **Edges**: Two CST edges (time evolution of $i$ and $j$) plus two spatial connections
909: - **Count**: $\binom{N}{2} \times T$
910: 
911: **2. Spatial plaquettes** (IG × CST):
912: 
913: $$
914: \square_{\text{space}}(i \to j, t) = (n_{i,t}, n_{j,t}, n_{j,t+1}, n_{i,t+1})
915: $$
916: 
917: - **Edges**:
918:   - $(n_{i,t}, n_{j,t})$: IG edge (cloning interaction)
919:   - $(n_{j,t}, n_{j,t+1})$: CST edge (time evolution of $j$)
920:   - $(n_{j,t+1}, n_{i,t+1})$: IG edge at $t+1$ or spatial connection
921:   - $(n_{i,t+1}, n_{i,t})$: CST edge backwards (time evolution of $i$, reversed)
922: - **Count**: $O(N^2 T)$
923: 
924: **3. Mixed plaquettes** (IG × IG):
925: 
926: $$
927: \square_{\text{mixed}}(i,j,k,t) = (n_{i,t}, n_{j,t}, n_{k,t}, n_{i,t})
928: $$
929: 
930: - **Edges**: Three IG edges forming a triangle
931: - **Count**: $O(N^3)$ per timestep (rare, requires dense interaction graph)

hints.label: def-discrete-ym-action
hints.title: Discrete Yang-Mills Action
hints.content:
939: :label: def-discrete-ym-action
940: 
941: The **discrete Yang-Mills action** on the Fractal Set is:
942: 
943: $$
944: S_{\text{YM}} = \frac{1}{g^2} \sum_{\square} S_{\square}
945: $$
946: 
947: where:
948: 
949: $$
950: S_{\square} = 2\left(1 - \frac{1}{2}\text{Tr}(U_{\square})\right)
951: $$
952: 
953: is the **plaquette action** (Wilson action).
954: 
955: **Expansion for small fields**: For $||A_e|| \ll 1$:
956: 
957: $$
958: U_{\square} \approx I + i\tau^2 \sum_a F_{\square}^{(a)} T^a - \frac{\tau^4}{2} \sum_a (F_{\square}^{(a)})^2 T^a T^a + O(\tau^6)
959: $$
960: 
961: Taking the trace:
962: 
963: $$
964: \text{Tr}(U_{\square}) = 2 - \frac{\tau^4}{4}\sum_{a=1}^3 (F_{\square}^{(a)})^2 + O(\tau^6)
965: $$
966: 
967: Therefore:
968: 
969: $$
970: S_{\square} = \frac{\tau^4}{4}\sum_{a=1}^3 (F_{\square}^{(a)})^2 + O(\tau^6)
971: $$
972: 
973: **Continuum limit**: As $\tau \to 0$:
974: 
975: $$
976: S_{\text{YM}} \to \frac{1}{4g^2} \int d^{d+1}x \sum_{a=1}^3 F_{\mu\nu}^{(a)} F^{(a),\mu\nu}
977: $$
978: 
979: (standard Yang-Mills action).
980: 
981: **Physical interpretation**:
982: - $\text{Tr}(U_{\square}) = 2$: Flat connection (no curvature)
hints.raw_directive:

hints.label: thm-ym-action-gauge-invariant
hints.title: Gauge Invariance of Yang-Mills Action
hints.content:
988: :label: thm-ym-action-gauge-invariant
989: 
990: The discrete Yang-Mills action $S_{\text{YM}}$ is **exactly gauge-invariant** under local SU(2) transformations.
991: 
992: **Proof**: Under $U_i \to V_i U_i V_i^\dagger$ at each node:
993: 
994: $$
995: U_{ij} \to V_i U_{ij} V_j^\dagger
996: $$
997: 
998: For plaquette $\square = (1,2,3,4)$:
999: 
1000: $$
1001: U_{\square}' = (V_1 U_{12} V_2^\dagger)(V_2 U_{23} V_3^\dagger)(V_3 U_{34} V_4^\dagger)(V_4 U_{41} V_1^\dagger)
1002: $$
1003: 
1004: $$
1005: = V_1 U_{12} U_{23} U_{34} U_{41} V_1^\dagger = V_1 U_{\square} V_1^\dagger
1006: $$
1007: 
1008: Therefore:
1009: 
1010: $$
1011: \text{Tr}(U_{\square}') = \text{Tr}(V_1 U_{\square} V_1^\dagger) = \text{Tr}(U_{\square})
1012: $$
